Jason Rogers wrote:

> 2. reasons we don't use Eclipse's built-in functionality:
>   a. Eclipse seemed to skip some tests in the 3.0.x branch (we would
> select 1 project whose tests would number N, its dependent projects
> would weigh in at M tests.  So you would expect N + M tests to have been
> run.  Not so.  It was N + M - X tests.  I don't know where things were
> getting lost.  I noticed this because I had a test in which I was
> forcing a failure and it never failed.  Why?  It never ran.)

Yipe!  Did you submit a bug?

    David Saff
